intro: Secamone nervosa, commonly known as the narrow-veined secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are typically clustered in umbels and feature five petals, often in shades of white or pink. Secamone nervosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
